raw_concept.name: Circles
raw_concept.description:
The collection of all the points in a plane, which are at a fixed distance from a fixed point in a plane is called a circle. 
A circle divides the plane in which it lies into 3 parts - interior of the circle(inside the circle), the circle and exterior of the circle(outside the circle).

concepts.concept_description:
The collection of all the points in a plane, which are at a fixed distance from a fixed point in a plane is called a circle. 
A circle divides the plane in which it lies into 3 parts - interior of the circle(inside the circle), the circle and exterior of the circle(outside the circle).

raw_concept.name: Circle Dividing a Plane
raw_concept.description: A circle divides the plane in which it lies into 3 parts - interior of the circle(inside the circle),the circle and exterior of the circle(outside the circle).

successors.concept_name: Circle dividing a plane
successors.concept_description: A circle divides the plane in which it lies into 3 parts - interior of the circle(inside the circle), the circle and exterior of the circle(outside the circle).

raw_concept.name: Radius
raw_concept.description: The radius of a circle is the length of the line from the center to any point on its edge.

concepts.concept_description: The radius of a circle is the length of the line from the center to any point on its edge.

raw_concept.name: Sector of a Circle
raw_concept.description: A circular sector or circle sector, is the portion of a disk enclosed by two radii and an arc, where the smaller area is known as the minor sector and the larger being the major sector.

successors.concept_name: Sector
successors.concept_description: The region between an arc and two radii.

raw_concept.name: Segment and Sector
raw_concept.description:
Region between a chord and arc is called a segment.
The region between an arc and two radii.

successors.concept_name: Segment and Sector
successors.concept_description:
Region between a chord and arc is called a segment.
The region between an arc and two radii.

raw_concept.name: Tangent and Secant
raw_concept.description:
Line touching the circle only at one point is called the tangent.
Line touching the circle at 2 points is called the tangent.

concepts.concept_description:
Line touching the circle only at one point is called the tangent.
Line touching the circle at 2 points is called the tangent.

raw_concept.name: Secant
raw_concept.description: Secant is the line which intersects the circle at two points

concepts.concept_description: _Line touching the circle at 2 points is called the tangent.

raw_concept.name: Chord
raw_concept.description: Line segment within the circle connecting 2 points on the circle is called the chord.

concepts.concept_description: Line segment within the circle connecting 2 points on the circle is called the chord.

raw_concept.name: Chords Equidistant from Center Are Equal
raw_concept.description: Chords equidistant from the center of a circle are equal in length.

successors.concept_name: Chords Equidistant from Center Are Equal
successors.concept_description: Chords equidistant from the center of a circle are equal in length.

raw_concept.name: Equal Chords Are at Equal Distances from the Center
raw_concept.description: Equal chords of a circle(or of congruent circles) are equidistant from the center(or centers)

successors.concept_name: Equal Chords Are at Equal Distances from the Center
successors.concept_description: Equal chords of a circle(or of congruent circles) are equidistant from the center(or centers)

raw_concept.name: Perpendicular from the Center to a Chord Bisects the Chord
raw_concept.description: Perpendicular from the center of a circle to a chord bisects the chord.

successors.concept_name: Perpendicular from the Center to a Chord Bisects the Chord
successors.concept_description: Perpendicular from the center of a circle to a chord bisects the chord.

raw_concept.name: Theorem of Equal Angles Subtended by Different Chords
raw_concept.description: If the angles subtended by the chords of a circle at the center are equal, then the chords are equal.

successors.concept_name: Theorem of Equal Angles Subtended by Different Chords
successors.concept_description: If the angles subtended by the chords of a circle at the center are equal, then the chords are equal.

raw_concept.name: Segment and Sector
raw_concept.description:
Region between a chord and arc is called a segment.
The region between an arc and two radii.

successors.concept_name: Segment and Sector
successors.concept_description:
Region between a chord and arc is called a segment.
The region between an arc and two radii.

raw_concept.name: A Line through the Center That Bisects the Chord Is Perpendicular to the Chord.
raw_concept.description: The line drawn through the center of a circle to bisect a chord is perpendicular to the chord

successors.concept_name: A Line through the Center That Bisects the Chord Is Perpendicular to the Chord.
successors.concept_description: The line drawn through the center of a circle to bisect a chord is perpendicular to the chord

raw_concept.name: Theorem of Equal Chords Subtending Angles at the Center
raw_concept.description: Equal chords subtend equal angles at the center - Proof.

successors.concept_name: Theorem of Equal Chords Subtending Angles at the Center
successors.concept_description: Equal chords subtend equal angles at the center - Proof.

raw_concept.name: Diameter
raw_concept.description: Chord passing through the center of the circle is called the diameter. Diameter is the longest chord.

concepts.concept_description: Chord passing through the center of the circle is called the diameter. Diameter is the longest chord.

raw_concept.name: Arc
raw_concept.description: A piece of a circle between two points is called an arc.

concepts.concept_description: A piece of a circle between two points is called an arc.

raw_concept.name: Sector of a Circle
raw_concept.description: A circular sector or circle sector, is the portion of a disk enclosed by two radii and an arc, where the smaller area is known as the minor sector and the larger being the major sector.

successors.concept_name: Sector

raw_concept.description:
Region between a chord and arc is called a segment.

raw_concept.name: Angle Subtended by an Arc of a Circle on the Circle and at the Center
raw_concept.description: The angle subtended by an arc at the center is double the angle subtended by it any part of the circle.

successors.concept_name: Angle Subtended by an Arc of a Circle on the Circle and at the Center
successors.concept_description: The angle subtended by an arc at the center is double the angle subtended by it any part of the circle.

raw_concept.name: Angles in Same Segment of a Circle
raw_concept.description: Angles in the same segment of a circle are equal.

successors.concept_name: Angles in Same Segment of a Circle
successors.concept_description: Angles in the same segment of a circle are equal.

raw_concept.name: Line Segment That Subtends Equal Angles at Two Other Points
raw_concept.description: If a line segment joining two points subtends equal angles at two other points lying on the same side of the line containing the line segment, the four points lie on a circle.(i.e they are concyclic)

successors.concept_name: Line Segment That Subtends Equal Angles at Two Other Points
successors.concept_description: If a line segment joining two points subtends equal angles at two other points lying on the same side of the line containing the line segment, the four points lie on a circle.(i.e they are concyclic)

raw_concept.name: Angle Subtended by Diameter on the Circle
raw_concept.description: Angle subtended by diameter on a circle is 90 degree.

successors.concept_name: Angle Subtended by Diameter on the Circle
successors.concept_description: Angle subtended by diameter on a circle is 90 degree.

raw_concept.name: Circumference
raw_concept.description: Length of the complete circle is called the circumference.

concepts.concept_description: Length of the complete circle is called the circumference.

raw_concept.description: SSS, SAS, AAS, ASA, RHS Criteria for Congruency of triangles

raw_concept.name: Circle through 3 Points
raw_concept.description: There is one and only one circle passing through three given non-collinear points.

concepts.concept_description: There is one and only one circle passing through three given non-collinear points.

raw_concept.name: Exterior Angle of a Triangle
raw_concept.description: The exterior angle in a triangle is equal to the sum of its two opposite interior angles.S_Memory

concepts.concept_description: The exterior angle in a triangle is equal to the sum of its two opposite interior angles.S_Memory

raw_concept.description: The angle subtended by an arc at the center is double the angle subtended by it any part of the circle.

raw_concept.name: Quadrilaterals
raw_concept.description: How to form quadrilaterals from four given point no three of which are collinear and concept of formation of shapes from points taking all four or any three to be collinear.

raw_concept.name: Cyclic Quadrilateral
raw_concept.description: A Quadrilateral is called a cyclic quadrilateral if all the four vertices lie on a circle

successors.concept_name: Cyclic Quadrilateral
successors.concept_description: A Quadrilateral is called a cyclic quadrilateral if all the four vertices lie on a circle

raw_concept.name: Sum of Pair of Opposite Angles in Quadrilateral
raw_concept.description: If sum of a pair of opposite angles of a quadrilateral is 180 degree, the quadrilateral is cyclic.

successors.concept_name: Sum of Pair of Opposite Angles in Quadrilateral
successors.concept_description: If sum of a pair of opposite angles of a quadrilateral is 180 degree, the quadrilateral is cyclic.

raw_concept.name: Sum of Opposite Angles of a Cyclic Quadrilateral
raw_concept.description: The sum of either pair of opposite angles of a cyclic quadrilateral is 180 degree

successors.concept_name: Sum of Opposite Angles of a Cyclic Quadrilateral
